title: Diego Simeone: I rejected £30m offer to quit Atletico Madrid last summer
text:
Atleti head coach Diego Simeone made his decision after losing the Champions League final (Photo: Handout) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Diego Simeone has revealed he turned down a €35million (£30million) offer to leave Atletico Madrid last summer — but stopped short of saying who from. 
Atleti suffered Champions League heartache in May after losing out to local rivals Real in the final for the second time in three years. Soon after, Simeone was approached by another European club — believed to be Paris Saint-Germain — about taking charge. 
In the end, his affinity to the club persuaded him to remain at the Vicente Calderon, and he has no regrets. 
Speaking about last May's defeat, he told AS: "I got to the press room and had to go through the area where Real Madrid were celebrating and I felt a lot of pain, and I started to think that this was going to be a difficult year and it would be hard to motivate my players again. Simeone after the 2016 Champions League final (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
"I said what I felt, that I needed to think about it. Is that so bad? You have to remember if I wanted to go to another team I would have had 35 million reasons. 35 million! But I didn't leave because I didn't want to." 
Domestically, Atletio have had a disappointing season. They are fourth in La Liga, 10 points behind leaders Real Madrid. They are, however, through to the Champions league quarter-finals, where they will face Leicester, and Simeone believes the club is on an upward trajectory. "I don't want to leave because I still feel I identify with what I'm doing with the club and because I still have a huge bond with the team and I know we're still growing," Simeone added. 
"The club is in the best shape possible, we have a new stadium and we'll have a bigger budget for the future." Like us on Facebook
